crew: Jim Carrey, Laura Linney, Noah Emmerich, Natascha McElhone, Holland Taylor, Ed Harris, Brian Delate, Una Damon, Paul Giamatti, Philip Baker Hall, Peter Weir, Andrew Niccol, Lynn Pleshette, Scott Rudin, Andrew Niccol, Edward S. Feldman, Adam Schroeder

title: Big
synopsis: After a wish turns 12-year-old Josh Baskin (David Moscow) into a 30-year-old man (Tom Hanks), he heads to New York City and gets a low-level job at MacMillen Toy Company. A chance encounter with the owner (Robert Loggia) of the company leads to a promotion testing new toys. Soon a fellow employee, Susan Lawrence (Elizabeth Perkins), takes a romantic interest in Josh. However, the pressure of living as an adult begins to overwhelm him, and he longs to return to his simple, former life as a boy.
consensus: Refreshingly sweet and undeniably funny, Big is a showcase for Tom Hanks, who dives into his role and infuses it with charm and surprising poignancy.
crew: Tom Hanks, Elizabeth Perkins, Robert Loggia, John Heard, Jared Rushton, David Moscow, Jon Lovitz, Mercedes Ruehl, Tracy Reiner, Penny Marshall, James L. Brooks, Robert Greenhut, Howard Shore, Barry Sonnenfeld, Barry Malkin, Paula Herold, Juliet Taylor, Santo Loquasto, Speed Hopkins

title: The Rules of the Game
synopsis: In this melancholy French social satire, André (Roland Toutain) is having an affair with Christine (Nora Gregor), whose husband, Robert (Marcel Dalio), himself is hiding a mistress. Meanwhile Christine's married maid, Lisette (Paulette Dubost), is romantically entangled with the local poacher. At a hunting party, trusted friend Octave (Jean Renoir) also confesses his feelings for Christine, as the passions of the servants and aristocrats dangerously collide.
consensus: Its genius escaped many viewers at the time, but in retrospect, The Rules of the Game stands as one of Jean Renoir's -- and cinema's -- finest works.
crew: Marcel Dalio, Nora Gregor, Mila Parely, Roland Toutain, Jean Renoir, Paulette Dubost, Gaston Modot, Julien Carette, Odette Talazac, Pierre Magnier, Jean Renoir, Carl Koch, Jean Renoir, Claude Renoir, Jean-Paul Alphen, Jean Bachelet, Jacques Lemare, Alain Renoir, Marthe Huguet

title: Back to the Future
synopsis: In this 1980s sci-fi classic, small-town California teen Marty McFly (Michael J. Fox) is thrown back into the '50s when an experiment by his eccentric scientist friend Doc Brown (Christopher Lloyd) goes awry. Traveling through time in a modified DeLorean car, Marty encounters young versions of his parents (Crispin Glover, Lea Thompson), and must make sure that they fall in love or he'll cease to exist. Even more dauntingly, Marty has to return to his own time and save the life of Doc Brown.
consensus: Inventive, funny, and breathlessly constructed, Back to the Future is a rousing time-travel adventure with an unforgettable spirit.
crew: Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Crispin Glover, Lea Thompson, Wendie Jo Sperber, Marc McClure, Claudia Wells, Thomas F. Wilson, James Tolkan, Casey Siemaszko, Robert Zemeckis, Kathleen Kennedy, Frank Marshall, Steven Spielberg, Bob Gale, Neil Canton, Alan Silvestri, Johnny Colla, Dean Cundey

title: Enough Said
synopsis: Eva (Julia Louis-Dreyfus), a divorced single parent, seems generally happy but dreads her daughter's departure for college. Unexpectedly, Eva begins a romance with Albert (James Gandolfini), a nice man with whom she has much in common. Meanwhile, Eva finds a new friend in Marianne (Catherine Keener), a poet who is just about perfect except for one thing: She constantly denigrates her ex-husband -- Albert. The more Eva hears, the more she doubts her relationship with him.
consensus: Wryly charming, impeccably acted, and ultimately quite bittersweet, Enough Said is a grown-up movie in the best possible way.
crew: Julia Louis-Dreyfus, James Gandolfini, Catherine Keener, Toni Collette, Tavi Gevinson, Ben Falcone, Tracey Fairaway, Eve Hewson, Michaela Watkins, Phillip Brock, Nicole Holofcener, Nicole Holofcener, Anthony Bregman, Stefanie Azpiazu, Chrisann Verges, Keith Cunningham, Robert Frazen, Marcelo Zarvos

title: The Apartment
synopsis: Insurance worker C.C. Baxter (Jack Lemmon) lends his Upper West Side apartment to company bosses to use for extramarital affairs. When his manager Mr. Sheldrake (Fred MacMurray) begins using Baxter's apartment in exchange for promoting him, Baxter is disappointed to learn that Sheldrake's mistress is Fran Kubelik (Shirley MacLaine), the elevator girl at work whom Baxter is interested in himself. Soon Baxter must decide between the girl he loves and the advancement of his career.
consensus: Director Billy Wilder's customary cynicism is leavened here by tender humor, romance, and genuine pathos.
crew: Jack Lemmon, Shirley MacLaine, Fred MacMurray, Ray Walston, Jack Kruschen, Joan Shawlee, Edie Adams, Hope Holiday, Naomi Stevens, Billy Wilder, Billy Wilder, I.A.L. Diamond, Billy Wilder, Daniel Mandell, Adolph Deutsch

title: Bull Durham
synopsis: In Durham, N.C., the Bulls minor league baseball team has one asset no other can claim: a poetry-loving groupie named Annie Savoy (Susan Sarandon). As the team's season begins, Annie selects brash new recruit Ebby Calvin Laloosh (Tim Robbins), whom she christens "Nuke," to inspire with the religion of baseball. Nuke also receives guidance from veteran player Crash Davis (Kevin Costner), who settles Nuke's erratic pitching and teaches him to follow the catcher's lead.
consensus: Kevin Costner at his funniest and most charismatic in Bull Durham, a film that's as wise about relationships as it is about minor league baseball.
crew: Kevin Costner, Susan Sarandon, Tim Robbins, Trey Wilson, Robert Wuhl, Jenny Robertson, Max Patkin, David Neidorf, Ron Shelton, David V. Lester, Thom Mount, Mark Burg, Michael Convertino, Bobby Byrne, Bonnie Timmermann, Armin Ganz

title: The Edge of Seventeen
synopsis: Everyone knows that growing up is hard, and life is no easier for high school junior Nadine (Hailee Steinfeld), who is already at peak awkwardness when her all-star older brother Darian (Blake Jenner) starts dating her best friend Krista (Haley Lu Richardson). All at once, Nadine feels more alone than ever, until an unexpected friendship with a thoughtful teen (Hayden Szeto) gives her a glimmer of hope that things just might not be so terrible after all.
consensus: The Edge of Seventeen's sharp script -- and Hailee Steinfeld's outstanding lead performance -- make this more than just another coming-of-age dramedy.
producer: James L. Brooks, Richard Sakai, Julie Ansell
crew: Hailee Steinfeld, Haley Lu Richardson, Blake Jenner, Kyra Sedgwick, Woody Harrelson, Hayden Szeto, Alexander Calvert, Eric Keenleyside, Nesta Cooper, Kelly Fremon Craig, Kelly Fremon Craig, James L. Brooks, Richard Sakai, Julie Ansell, Brendan Ferguson, Cathy Schulman, Wang Zhongjun, Wang Zhonglei

title: Deadpool 2
synopsis: Wisecracking mercenary Deadpool meets Russell, an angry teenage mutant who lives at an orphanage. When Russell becomes the target of Cable -- a genetically enhanced soldier from the future -- Deadpool realizes that he'll need some help saving the boy from such a superior enemy. He soon joins forces with Bedlam, Shatterstar, Domino and other powerful mutants to protect young Russell from Cable and his advanced weaponry.
consensus: Though it threatens to buckle under the weight of its meta gags, Deadpool 2 is a gory, gleeful lampoon of the superhero genre buoyed by Ryan Reynolds' undeniable charm.
rating: R (Language Throughout|Brief Drug Material|Sexual References|Strong Violence)
producer: Ryan Reynolds, Simon Kinberg, Lauren Shuler Donner
writer: Ryan Reynolds, Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick
crew: Ryan Reynolds, Josh Brolin, Morena Baccarin, Zazie Beetz, Brianna Hildebrand, Julian Dennison, Stefan Kapicic, T.J. Miller, Terry Crews, Bill Skarsgård, David Leitch, Ryan Reynolds, Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick, Ryan Reynolds, Simon Kinberg, Lauren Shuler Donner, Stan Lee, Jonathon Komack Martin, Kelly McCormick

title: The Muppets
synopsis: Walter, the world's biggest Muppet fan, is on vacation in Los Angeles with his brother Gary (Jason Segel) and Gary's girlfriend, Mary (Amy Adams). They discover that greedy Tex Richman (Chris Cooper) plans to raze Muppet Studios and drill for oil on the spot. Desperate to save the Muppets' former stomping grounds, the three friends join forces with Kermit to reunite Miss Piggy, Fozzie and the rest of the gang to hold a telethon to raise the $10 million they need to save the studio .
consensus: Clever, charming, and heartfelt, The Muppets is a welcome big screen return for Jim Henson's lovable creations that will both win new fans and delight longtime devotees.
crew: Jason Segel, Amy Adams, Chris Cooper, Rashida Jones, Alan Arkin, James Carville, Donald Glover, Leslie Feist, Ken Jeong, Judd Hirsch, James Bobin, Jason Segel, Nicholas Stoller, David Hoberman, Todd Lieberman, Jason Segel, Nicholas Stoller, John G. Scotti, Martin G. Baker, Christophe Beck

title: Broadcast News
synopsis: Intelligent satire of American television news. A highly strung news producer finds herself strangely attracted to a vapid anchorman even through she loathes everything he personifies. To make matters worse, her best friend, a talented but not particularly telegenic news reporter, is secretly in love with her.
consensus: Blockbuster dramatist James L. Brooks delivers with Broadcast News, fully entertaining with deft, deep characterization.
crew: William Hurt, Albert Brooks, Holly Hunter, Robert Prosky, Lois Chiles, Joan Cusack, Peter Hackes, Christian Clemenson, Robert Katims, Ed Wheeler, James L. Brooks, James L. Brooks, James L. Brooks, Polly Platt, Michael Ballhaus, Richard Marks, Bill Conti

title: Silver Linings Playbook
synopsis: After losing his job and wife, and spending time in a mental institution, Pat Solatano (Bradley Cooper) winds up living with his parents (Robert De Niro, Jacki Weaver). He wants to rebuild his life and reunite with his wife, but his parents would be happy if he just shared their obsession with the Philadelphia Eagles. Things get complicated when Pat meets Tiffany (Jennifer Lawrence), who offers to help him reconnect with his wife, if he will do something very important for her in exchange.
consensus: Silver Linings Playbook walks a tricky thematic tightrope, but David O. Russell's sensitive direction and some sharp work from a talented cast gives it true balance.
producer: Donna Gigliotti, Bruce Cohen, Jonathan Gordon
crew: Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro, Jacki Weaver, Chris Tucker, Anupam Kher, Julia Stiles, John Ortiz, Shea Whigham, Dash Mihok, David O. Russell, David O. Russell, Donna Gigliotti, Bruce Cohen, Jonathan Gordon, Bob Weinstein, Harvey Weinstein, George Para, Michelle Raimo, Bradley Cooper

title: Lost in Translation
synopsis: A lonely, aging movie star named Bob Harris (Bill Murray) and a conflicted newlywed, Charlotte (Scarlett Johansson), meet in Tokyo. Bob is there to film a Japanese whiskey commercial; Charlotte is accompanying her celebrity-photographer husband. Strangers in a foreign land, the two find escape, distraction and understanding amidst the bright Tokyo lights after a chance meeting in the quiet lull of the hotel bar. They form a bond that is as unlikely as it is heartfelt and meaningful.
consensus: Effectively balancing humor and subtle pathos, Sofia Coppola crafts a moving, melancholy story that serves as a showcase for both Bill Murray and Scarlett Johansson.
crew: Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson, Giovanni Ribisi, Anna Faris, Fumihiro Hayashi, Catherine Lambert, Gregory Pekar, Sofia Coppola, Sofia Coppola, Sofia Coppola, Ross Katz, Francis Ford Coppola, Fred Roos, Lance Acord, Anne Ross, K.K. Barrett, Nancy Steiner

title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
synopsis: When the idealistic young Jefferson Smith (James Stewart) winds up appointed to the United States Senate, he gains the mentorship of Senator Joseph Paine (Claude Rains). However, Paine isn't as noble as his reputation would indicate, and he becomes involved in a scheme to discredit Smith, who wants to build a boys' campsite where a more lucrative project could go. Determined to stand up against Paine and his corrupt peers, Smith takes his case to the Senate floor.
consensus: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington -- and returns with an uplifting ode to idealism that distills the strengths of its director and leading man.
crew: James Stewart, Jean Arthur, Claude Rains, Edward Arnold, Guy Kibbee, Eugene Pallette, Beulah Bondi, H.B. Warner, Harry Carey, Frank Capra, Lewis R. Foster, Sidney Buchman, Frank Capra, Dimitri Tiomkin, Joseph Walker, Al Clark, Gene Havlick, Lionel Banks

title: Won't You Be My Neighbor?
synopsis: Filmmaker Morgan Neville examines the life and legacy of Fred Rogers, the beloved host of the popular children's TV show "Mister Rogers' Neighborhood."
consensus: Won't You Be My Neighbor? takes a fittingly patient and honest look at the life and legacy of a television pioneer whose work has enriched generations.
crew: Joanne Rogers, Bill Isler, Hedda Sharapan, Margaret Whitmer, Betty Seamans, Morgan Neville, Leslie Berriman, John Boccardo, Caryn Capotosto, Nicholas Ma, Jeff Malmberg, Aaron Wickenden

title: I Am Not Your Negro
synopsis: In 1979, James Baldwin wrote a letter to his literary agent describing his next project, "Remember This House." The book was to be a revolutionary, personal account of the lives and assassinations of three of his close friends: Medgar Evers, Malcolm X and Martin Luther King, Jr. At the time of Baldwin's death in 1987, he left behind only 30 completed pages of this manuscript. Filmmaker Raoul Peck envisions the book James Baldwin never finished.
consensus: I Am Not Your Negro offers an incendiary snapshot of James Baldwin's crucial observations on American race relations -- and a sobering reminder of how far we've yet to go.
producer: Rémi Grellety, Raoul Peck, Hébert Peck
crew: Samuel L. Jackson, Raoul Peck, Raoul Peck, Henry Adebonojo, Bill Ross, Turner Ross

title: Apollo 11
synopsis: Never-before-seen footage and audio recordings take you straight into the heart of NASA's most celebrated mission as astronauts Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin and Michael Collins embark on a historic trip to the moon.
consensus: Edifying and inspiring in equal measure, Apollo 11 uses artfully repurposed archival footage to send audiences soaring back to a pivotal time in American history.
producer: Todd Douglas Miller, Thomas Petersen, Evan Krauss
crew: Bill Anders, H. David Reed, Todd Douglas Miller, Courtney Sexton, Amy Entelis, Josh Braun, Todd Douglas Miller, Evan Krauss, Buzz Aldrin, Todd Douglas Miller, Matt Morton

title: Life Itself
synopsis: Filmmaker Steve James chronicles the life of film critic Roger Ebert, especially his career highlights, his battle with alcohol, and his sometimes ruthless rivalry with fellow critic Gene Siskel.
consensus: Rich in detail and warmly affectionate, Life Itself offers a joyful yet poignant tribute to a critical cinematic legacy.
producer: Zak Piper, Steve James, Garrett Basch
crew: Roger Ebert, Ava DuVernay, Zak Piper, Garrett Basch, Martin Scorsese, Steven Zaillian, Michael W. Ferro Jr., Gordon Quinn, Justine Nagan, Kat White

title: Man on Wire
synopsis: Using actual footage from the event seamlessly mingled with new re-enactments, filmmaker James Marsh masterfully recreates high-wire daredevil Philippe Petit's 1974 stunt: performing acrobatics on a thin wire strung between the Twin Towers of the World Trade Center. Plotting his feat like a master cat burglar, Petit enlists the help of a motley group of friends as he calculates every detail, from acquiring building access to stringing up the wire, and manages to pull off an astounding crime.
consensus: James Marsh's doc about artist Phililppe Petit's artful caper brings you every ounce of suspense that can be wrung from a man on a (suspended) wire.
crew: Annie Allix, Jean François Heckel, James Marsh, Simon Chinn, Nick Fraser, Andrea Meditch

title: Amazing Grace
synopsis: Singer Aretha Franklin performs gospel songs at the New Temple Missionary Baptist Church in Los Angeles in 1972.
consensus: Brilliantly capturing a remarkable performer near the peak of her prodigious power, Amazing Grace is a thrilling must-watch documentary for Aretha Franklin fans.
producer: Alan Elliott, Aretha Franklin, Jerry Wexler, Joe Boyd, Rob Johnson, Chiemi Karasawa, Sabrina V. Owens, Tirrell D. Whittley, Joseph Woolf
crew: Aretha Franklin, Alan Elliott, Alan Elliott, Aretha Franklin, Jerry Wexler, Chiemi Karasawa, Joseph Woolf

title: Minding the Gap
synopsis: Three young men bond together to escape volatile families in their Rust Belt hometown. As they face adult responsibilities, unexpected revelations threaten their decade-long friendship.
consensus: Minding the Gap draws on more than a decade of documentary footage to assemble a poignant picture of young American lives that resonates far beyond its onscreen subjects.
crew: Bing Liu, Bing Liu, Sally Jo Fifer, Bing Liu, Diane Moy Quon, Bing Liu, Bing Liu, Joshua Altman, Chris Ruggiero

title: Faces Places
synopsis: Director Agnès Varda and photographer and muralist JR journey through rural France and form an unlikely friendship.
consensus: Equal parts breezily charming and poignantly powerful, Faces Places is a unique cross-generational portrait of life in rural France from the great Agnès Varda.
crew: Agnès Varda, Agnès Varda, Rosalie Varda, Nicolas Guicheteau

title: Three Identical Strangers
synopsis: Identical triplets become separated at birth and adopted by three different families. Years later, their amazing reunion becomes a global sensation but also unearths an unimaginable secret that has radical repercussions.
consensus: Surreal and surprising, Three Identical Strangers effectively questions the nature of reality and identity.
genre: history, documentary, mystery and thriller, drama, biography
crew: David Kellman, Lawrence Wright, Will Ennis, Scotty Murray, Silvi Alzetta-Reali, Tim Wardle, Grace Hughes-Hallett, Tom Barry, Dimitri Doganis, Grace Hughes-Hallett

title: McQueen
synopsis: Archival footage and interviews with friends and family offer insight into the extraordinary life and career of British fashion designer Alexander McQueen.
consensus: McQueen offers an intimate, well-sourced, and overall moving look at a young life and brilliant career that were tragically cut short.
producer: Ian Bonhôte, Andee Ryder, Nick Taussig, Paul Van Carter
crew: Bernard Arnault, Jodie Kidd, Kate Moss, Michelle Olley, Peter Ettedgui, Peter Ettedgui, Andee Ryder, Nick Taussig, Paul Van Carter, Alexander Alexandrov

title: Crip Camp
synopsis: A groundbreaking summer camp galvanizes teens who have disabilities.
consensus: As entertaining as it is inspiring, Crip Camp uses one group's remarkable story to highlight hope for the future and the power of community.
crew: Dennis Billups, HolLynn D'Lil, Judith Heumann, Denise Sherer Jacobson, Lionel Je'Woodyard, James Lebrecht, Jim LeBrecht, Nicole Newnham, James Lebrecht, Nicole Newnham, Barack Obama, Michelle Obama, Priya Swaminathan, Tonia Davis, Howard Gertler, James Lebrecht

title: 20 Feet From Stardom
synopsis: Filmmaker Morgan Neville shines a long-overdue spotlight on the hit-making contributions of longtime backup singers like Darlene Love and Merry Clayton.
consensus: Rich, insightful, and occasionally heartbreaking, 20 Feet From Stardom is an energetic tribute to the passion, talent, and hard work of backup singers.
producer: Gil Friesen, Caitrin Rogers, Morgan Neville
crew: David Bowie, Ray Charles, Sheryl Crow, Lou Adler, Patti Austin, Chris Botti, Morgan Neville, Gil Friesen, Caitrin Rogers, Morgan Neville, George Conrades, Art Bilger, Peter Morton, Joel S. Ehrenkranz, Nicola B. Marsh

title: Weiner
synopsis: Former Rep. Anthony Weiner (D-N.Y.) runs for mayor of New York in 2013, but a new sex scandal ruins his attempt at a political comeback.
consensus: Weiner uses sharp insight and untrammeled access to offer a portrait of a political and personal collapse that's as queasy as it is undeniably compelling.
writer: Josh Kriegman, Elyse Steinberg, Eli Despres
crew: Anthony Weiner, Huma Abedin, Elyse Steinberg, Elyse Steinberg, Eli Despres, Elyse Steinberg, Julie Goldman, Christopher Clements, Carolyn Hepburn

title: Collective
synopsis: Directed by Alexander Nanau (TOTO AND HIS SISTERS), COLLECTIVE follows a heroic team of journalists as they uncover shocking, widespread corruption. After a deadly nightclub fire, the mysterious death of the owner of a powerful pharmaceutical firm, and the quiet resignation of a health minister—seemingly unrelated events, all within weeks of each other--the team of intrepid reporters exposes a much larger, much more explosive political scandal. COLLECTIVE is a fast-paced, real-time detective story about truth, accountability, and the value of an independent press in partisan times.
consensus: Collective presents a darkly effective overview of the cycle of political corruption and public cynicism that takes hold when government abrogates its responsibility to the people.
producer: Hanka Kastelicová, Bernard Michaux, Alexander Nanau, Bianca Oana
crew: Alexander Nanau, Alexander Nanau, Antoaneta Opris, Alexander Nanau, Bianca Oana, Alexander Nanau, Dana Bunescu

title: Amy
synopsis: Archival footage and personal testimonials present an intimate portrait of the life and career of British singer/songwriter Amy Winehouse.
consensus: As riveting as it is sad, Amy is a powerfully honest look at the twisted relationship between art and celebrity -- and the lethal spiral of addiction.
crew: Salaam Remi, Nick Shymansky, Blake Fielder-Civil, Mitch Winehouse, Mos Def, Asif Kapadia, James Gay-Rees, Antonio Pinto

title: Dick Johnson Is Dead
synopsis: A filmmaker and her elderly father stage his death in various ways to help them face his inevitable demise.
consensus: Dick Johnson Is Dead celebrates a life with bittersweet humor and grace, offering a deeply resonant perspective on mortality in the bargain.
crew: Kirsten Johnson, Dick Johnson, Kirsten Johnson, Kirsten Johnson, Nels Bangerter, Katy Chevigny, Marilyn Ness, Megan Ellison, Nels Bangerter, John Lavin, Gabriella Moses

title: Free Solo
synopsis: Alex Honnold completes the first free solo climb of famed El Capitan's 3,000-foot vertical rock face at Yosemite National Park.
consensus: Free Solo depicts athletic feats that many viewers will find beyond reason - and grounds the attempts in passions that are all but universal.
producer: Elizabeth Chai Vasarhelyi, Jimmy Chin, Evan Hayes, Shannon Dill
crew: Alex Honnold, Tommy Caldwell, Jimmy Chin, Cheyne Lempe, Dierdre Wolownick, Peter Croft, Elizabeth Chai Vasarhelyi, Jimmy Chin, Elizabeth Chai Vasarhelyi, Jimmy Chin, Evan Hayes, Shannon Dill, Walter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald, Tim Pastore, Matt Renner

title: The Last Waltz
synopsis: Seventeen years after joining forces as the backing band for rockabilly cult hero Ronnie Hawkins, Canadian roots rockers The Band call it quits with a lavish farewell show at San Francisco's Winterland Ballroom on Nov. 25, 1976. Filmed by Martin Scorsese, this documentary features standout performances by rock legends such as Bob Dylan, Van Morrison, Eric Clapton, Joni Mitchell and Muddy Waters, as well as interviews tracing the group's history and discussing road life.
consensus: Among one of, if not the best rock movie ever made, The Last Waltz is a revealing, electrifying view of the classic band at their height.
crew: Robbie Robertson, Ringo Starr, Ron Wood, Neil Young, Paul Butterfield, Eric Clapton, Rick Danko, Neil Diamond, Dr. John, Martin Scorsese, L.A. Johnson, Frank Marshall, Robbie Robertson, Jonathan T. Taplin, Neil Diamond, Michael Chapman, Vilmos Zsigmond, Boris Leven

title: Kedi
synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of cats have roamed the metropolis of Istanbul freely for thousands of years, wandering in and out of people's lives, impacting them in ways only an animal who lives between the worlds of the wild and the tamed can. Cats and their kittens bring joy and purpose to those they choose, giving people an opportunity to reflect on life and their place in it. In Istanbul, cats are the mirrors to ourselves.
consensus: Kedi is a cat fancier's dream, but this thoughtful, beautifully filmed look at Istanbul's street feline population offers absorbing viewing for filmgoers of any purr-suasion.
crew: Ceyda Torun, Ceyda Torun, Charlie Wuppermann, Gregor Kewel, Thomas Podstawski, Alp Korfali, Charlie Wuppermann

title: Totally Under Control
synopsis: Public health officials discuss the U.S. government's response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
consensus: Totally Under Control does a commendable job of distilling current events into a clear-eyed overview that's as engaging as it is enraging.
director: Alex Gibney, Ophelia Harutyunyan, Suzanne Hillinger
crew: Alex Gibney, Taison Bell, Michael Bowen, Rick Bright, Caroline Chen, Thomas Frieden, Alex Gibney, Alex Gibney, Ophelia Harutyunyan, Suzanne Hillinger, Alison Ellwood, Mark Lampert, Andrew Morrison, Michael Sacks, Alex Gibney, Ophelia Harutyunyan

title: Stop Making Sense
synopsis: Director Jonathan Demme captures the frantic energy and artsy groove of Talking Heads in this concert movie shot at the Hollywood Pantages Theatre in 1983. The band's frontman, David Byrne, first appears on an empty stage, armed with only an acoustic guitar, and is gradually joined by bassist Tina Weymouth, drummer Chris Frantz, keyboardist Jerry Harrison and a cadre of backup singers as they perform the band's hits, culminating in an iconic performance featuring Byrne in an enormous suit.
consensus: Jonathan Demme's Stop Making Sense captures the energetic, unpredictable live act of peak Talking Heads with color and visual wit.
crew: Bernie Worrell, Alex Weir, Steve Scales, Lynn Mabry, Tina Weymouth, Jerry Harrison, Chris Frantz, David Byrne, Jonathan Demme, Gary Kurfirst, Gary Goetzman, David Byrne, Chris Frantz, Jerry Harrison, Talking Heads, Tina Weymouth, Jordan Cronenweth, Lisa Day

title: Knock Down the House
synopsis: A young bartender in the Bronx, a coal miner's daughter in West Virginia, a grieving mother in Nevada, and a registered nurse in Missouri build a movement of insurgent candidates to challenge powerful incumbents in Congress. One of their races will become the most shocking political upsets in recent American history.
consensus: A galvanizing glimpse behind the scenes of a pivotal election, Knock Down the House should prove engrossing for viewers of all political persuasions.
producer: Rachel Lears, Robin Blotnick, Sarah Olson
crew: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Rachel Lears, Rachel Lears, Robin Blotnick, Rachel Lears, Robin Blotnick, Sarah Olson, Kristin Lazure, Regina K. Scully, Stephanie Soechtig, Rachel Lears

title: Blackfish
synopsis: The story of Tilikum, a captive killer whale that has taken the lives of several people, underscores problems within the sea-park industry, man's relationship to nature, and how little has been learned about these highly intelligent mammals.
consensus: Blackfish is an aggressive, impassioned documentary that will change the way you look at performance killer whales.
writer: Gabriela Cowperthwaite, Eli Despres, Tim Zimmerman
crew: John Hargrove, Samantha Berg, Kim Ashdown, Dean Gomersall, Carol Ray, Dave Duffus, Gabriela Cowperthwaite, Gabriela Cowperthwaite, Eli Despres, Gabriela Cowperthwaite, Judy Bart, Erica Kahn, Christopher Towey

title: Taxi to the Dark Side
synopsis: This documentary explores the American military's use of torture by focusing on the unsolved murder of an Afhgani taxi driver who, in 2002, was taken for questioning at Bagram Force Air Base. Five days later, the man was dead. The medical examiner claimed the driver died from excessive physical abuse. Taking this case as a jumping-off point, the film examines wider claims of torture that occurred at bases like Abu Ghraib and Guantanamo Bay during the Bush administration.
consensus: Taxi to the Dark Side is an intelligent, powerful look into the dark corners of the War on Terror.
producer: Eva Orner, Susannah Shipman, Alex Gibney
crew: Alex Gibney, Brian Keith Allen, Jack Cloonan, Greg D'Agostino, Moazzam Begg, Alex Gibney, Alex Gibney, Eva Orner, Susannah Shipman, Alex Gibney, Don Glascoff, Sidney Blumenthal, Jedd Wider, Todd Wider

title: Time
synopsis: Entrepreneur Fox Rich spends the last two decades campaigning for the release of her husband, Rob G. Rich, who is serving a 60-year prison sentence for a robbery they both committed in the early 1990s in a moment of desperation.
consensus: Time delivers a powerful broadside against the flaws of the American justice system -- and chronicles one family's refusal to give up against all odds.
producer: Garrett Bradley, Lauren Domino, Kellen Quinn
crew: Garrett Bradley, Davis Guggenheim, Kathleen Lingo, Laurene Powell-Jobs, Nicole Stott, Garrett Bradley, Nisa East, Gabriel Rhodes

title: Maiden
synopsis: In 1989 Tracy Edwards leads the first all-female crew in the Whitbread Round the World Race, a grueling yachting competition that covers 33,000 miles and lasts nine months.
consensus: Enthralling viewing even for audiences with little to no knowledge of or interest in sailing, Maiden pays powerful tribute to a true pioneer.
rating: PG (Some Suggestive Content|Language|Brief Smoking Images|Thematic Elements)
crew: Tracy Edwards, Nancy Harris, John Chittenden, Bruno De Bois, Howard Gibbons, Jo Gooding, Angela Heath, Marie-Claude Heys, Alex Holmes, Alex Holmes, Victoria Gregory, James Erskine, Anna Godas, Oli Harbottle, Chris Openshaw, Katie Bryer, Rob Manning, Samuel Sim

title: Murderball
synopsis: This documentary introduces the U.S. quad rugby team -- a team composed entirely of young paraplegic men. Using special wheelchairs and very little protection, the players play full-contact competitive rugby, using rules only slightly altered to accommodate their limitations. The film follows the team as they discuss the sport, their lives, and how they ended up in their chairs to begin with, while they play their way to the 2004 Paralympic Games in Athens, Greece.
consensus: An entertaining and gripping documentary that shows being confined to a wheelchair doesn't mean the fun has to end.
director: Henry Alex Rubin, Dana Adam Shapiro
crew: Henry Alex Rubin, Dana Adam Shapiro, Christian Ettinger, Randy Manis, Jeff Sackman, Dana Adam Shapiro, Mark Urman, Henry Alex Rubin, Conor O'Neill, Geoffrey Richman

title: Jodorowsky's Dune
synopsis: Filmmaker Alejandro Jodorowsky discusses how he would have adapted Frank Herbert's classic sci-fi novel "Dune" for the big screen.
consensus: Part thoughtful tribute, part bittersweet reminder of a missed opportunity, Jodorowsky's Dune offers a fascinating look at a lost sci-fi legend.
producer: Frank Pavich, Stephen Scarlata, Travis Stevens
crew: Alejandro Jodorowsky, Amanda Lear, Brontis Jodorowsky, Chris Foss, Christian Vander, Devin Faraci, Frank Pavich, Donald Rosenfeld, Frank Pavich, Stephen Scarlata, Travis Stevens, David Cavallo, Alex Ricciardi, Kurt Stenzel

title: Welcome to Chechnya
synopsis: Activists risk their lives to confront Russian leader Ramzan Kadyrov and his government-directed campaign to detain, torture and execute LGBTQ Chechens.
consensus: An illuminating and urgent call to action, Welcome to Chechnya portrays the horrors of the mass persecution of the LGBTQ+ community in the Chechen Republic with tenacity and tenderness.
producer: David France, Alice Henty, Askold Kurov, Joy A. Tomchin
crew: David France, David France, David France, Alice Henty, Askold Kurov, Joy A. Tomchin, Nancy Abraham, Neal Baer, Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Masha Gessen

title: Tower
synopsis: On Aug. 1, 1966, a sniper rode the elevator to the top floor of the University of Texas Tower and opened fire, holding the campus hostage for 96 minutes. When the gunshots were finally silenced, the toll included 16 dead, three dozen wounded, and a shaken nation left trying to understand what had happened. Archival footage is combined with rotoscopic animation in a dynamic, never-before-seen way to illustrate the action-packed untold stories of the witnesses, heroes and survivors.
consensus: Tower probes into a painful chapter of American history with sensitivity and grace -- and revisits its events from a valuable new perspective.
crew: Violett Beane, Blair Jackson, Josephine McAdam, Reece Everett Ryan, Chris Doubek, Louie Arnette, Keith Maitland, Megan Gilbride, Pamela Colloff

title: Shirkers
synopsis: In 1992 teenager Sandi Tan shoots Singapore's first road movie with her enigmatic American mentor, Georges, who then absconded with all of the footage. The 16 mm film is recovered 20 years later, sending Tan, who is now a novelist living in Los Angeles, on a personal odyssey in search of Georges' footprints.
consensus: Shirkers uses one woman's interrogation of a pivotal personal disappointment to offer affecting observations on creativity, lost opportunity, and coming to terms with the past.
producer: Jessica Levin, Maya Rudolph, Sandi Tan
crew: Sandi Tan, Jessica Levin, Sandi Tan, Iris Ng, Kimberley Hassett, Sandi Tan

title: Anvil! The Story of Anvil
synopsis: Canadian heavy-metal band Anvil delivered a highly influential 1982 album that would inspire the likes of Anthrax and Metallica, and then dropped off the map to begin what would become decades of toiling in obscurity. Director and former roadie Sacha Gervasi follows guitarist Steve "Lips" Kudlow and drummer Robb Reiner as they stumble through a harrowing European tour and reflect on failure, friendship, resilience and the will to follow even the most impossible of dreams.
consensus: A touching, uplifting and inspirational rockumentary about an aging metal band, both hilarious and heart-warming in equal measure.
crew: Steve "Lips" Kudlow, Robb Reiner, Slash, Lars Ulrich, Lemmy Kilmister, Sacha Gervasi, Rebecca Yeldham

title: Inside Job
synopsis: The global financial meltdown that took place in Fall 2008 caused millions of job and home losses and plunged the United States into a deep economic recession. Matt Damon narrates a documentary that provides a detailed examination of the elements that led to the collapse and identifies keys financial and political players. Director Charles Ferguson conducts a wide range of interviews and traces the story from the United States to China to Iceland to several other global financial hot spots.
consensus: Disheartening but essential viewing, Charles Ferguson's documentary explores the 2008 Global Financial Crisis with exemplary rigor.
crew: Matt Damon, Gylfi Zoega, Andri Snær Magnason, Sigridur Benediktsdottir, Paul Volcker, Dominique Strauss-Kahn, George Soros, Barney Frank, Charles Ferguson, Charles Ferguson, Charles Ferguson, Audrey Marrs, Jeffrey Lurie, Christina Weiss Lurie

title: All In: The Fight for Democracy
synopsis: Filmmakers Liz Garbus and Lisa Cortes examine the history of voter suppression and the activists who fight for the rights of U.S. citizens.
consensus: All In: The Fight for Democracy lives up to its title as a galvanizing rallying cry for voters to exercise -- and preserve -- their right to be heard.
rating: PG-13 (Some Disturbing Violent Images|Thematic Material|Strong Language)
producer: Stacey Abrams, Dan Cogan, Lisa Cortes, Liz Garbus
crew: Stacey Abrams, Lisa Cortes, Liz Garbus, Jack Youngelson, Stacey Abrams, Dan Cogan, Lisa Cortes, Liz Garbus, Gil Talmi

title: The Square
synopsis: Egyptian revolutionaries battle their leaders and regime to build a new society.
consensus: The Square offers an electrifying -- and edifying -- ground-level glimpse of life inside a real-life political revolution.
crew: Ahmed Hassan, Khalid Abdalla, Magdy Ashour, Ramy Essam, Aida El-Kashef, Ragia Omran, Jehane Noujaim, Karim Amer, Daniel E. Catullo, Gavin Dougan, Geralyn White Dreyfous, Maxyne Franklin, Muhammad Hamdy, Mohammed El Manasterly

title: Jiro Dreams of Sushi
synopsis: Revered sushi chef Jiro Ono strives for perfection in his work, while his eldest son, Yoshikazu, has trouble living up to his father's legacy.
consensus: Beautiful, thoughtful, and engrossing, Jiro Dreams of Sushi should prove satisfying even for filmgoers who don't care for the cuisine.
crew: Jiro Ono, David Gelb, Joey Carey, Kevin Iwashina, Stefan Nowicki, Matt Weaver, Tom Pelligrini, David Gelb

title: Seymour: An Introduction
synopsis: Pianist Seymour Bernstein, who gave up performing for teaching, discusses his passion for music and his philosophy of life.
consensus: Seymour Bernstein's genuineness shines so brightly in Seymour: An Introduction that viewers will forgive debuting director Ethan Hawke's reverent treatment.
producer: Greg Loser, Heather Smith, Ryan Hawke
crew: Ethan Hawke, Greg Loser, Ryan Hawke, Anna Gustavi

title: The Missing Picture
synopsis: Filmmaker Rithy Panh re-creates atrocities of Cambodia's Khmer Rouge between 1975 and 1979.
consensus: Thrillingly unorthodox and emotionally searing without being didactic, The Missing Picture is a uniquely poignant documentary -- and so much more.
crew: Randal Douc, Rithy Panh, Rithy Panh, Catherine Dussart, Marc Marder, Rithy Panh, Marie-Christine Rougerie

title: Mucho Mucho Amor: The Legend of Walter Mercado
synopsis: Puerto Rican astrologer and psychic Walter Mercado discusses his life, career and post-fame seclusion.
consensus: An absorbing and affectionate tribute to a unique individual, Mucho Mucho Amor should prove fascinating for Walter Mercado fans as well as first-timers.
producer: Cristina Costantini, Alex Fumero, Kareem Tabsch
crew: Cristina Constantini, Kareem Tabsch, Alex Fumero, Lisa Leingang, Mona Panchal, Jeff Plunkett, Kareem Tabsch, Peter Alton

title: Deliver Us From Evil
synopsis: Filmmaker Amy Berg documents the case of convicted pedophile Oliver Grady who, as a priest in northern California, molested the children of his parishioners, apparently with the knowledge of his superiors in the diocese. Berg tracks down O'Grady in Ireland, where he lives free under church protection, and allows him to give his own account of his crimes.
consensus: Deliver Us From Evil is a superb documentary and a searing look at an institution protecting its leaders at the expense of its followers. A profoundly disturbing chronicle of a wolf in sheep's clothing, the film builds a clear-eyed case against pedophile priest Oliver O'Grady, and the Catholic bureaucracy that protected him. The recollections of O'Grady's victims are nothing short of shocking and heartbreaking.
producer: Amy Berg, Hermas Lassalle, Frank Donner
crew: Nancy Sloan, Roger Mahony, John Manly, Amy Berg, Amy Berg, Ray Baldwin, Tom Ortenberg, Amy Berg, Hermas Lassalle, Frank Donner, Matthew Cooke, Jacob Kusk, Jens Schlosser

title: Paris Is Burning
synopsis: This documentary focuses on drag queens living in New York City and their "house" culture, which provides a sense of community and support for the flamboyant and often socially shunned performers. Groups from each house compete in elaborate balls that take cues from the world of fashion. Also touching on issues of racism and poverty, the film features interviews with a number of renowned drag queens, including Willi Ninja, Pepper LaBeija and Dorian Corey.
consensus: Paris Is Burning dives into '80s transgender subculture, with the understated camera allowing this world to flourish and the people to speak (and dance) for themselves.
crew: André Christian, Freddie Pendavis, Willi Ninja, Pepper LaBeija, Junior Labeija, Shari Headley, Paris Duprée, Dorian Corey, Jennie Livingston, Jennie Livingston, Barry Swimar, Jonathan Oppenheim

title: Athlete A
synopsis: Reporters from The Indianapolis Star expose Dr. Larry Nassar's sexual abuse of young gymnasts.
consensus: Harrowing yet essential viewing, Athlete A shines an unforgiving light on horrific abuses -- as well as the culture that allowed them to continue unabated for years.
rating: PG-13 (Descriptions of Sexual Abuse|Mature Thematic Content)
producer: Serin Marshall, Jen Sey, Julie Parker Benello
crew: Jen Sey, Bonni Cohen, Jon Shenk, Richard Berge, Dan Cogan, Serin Marshall, Jen Sey, Julie Parker Benello, Jeff Beal

title: One Child Nation
synopsis: After becoming a mother, a filmmaker uncovers the untold history of China's one-child policy and the generations of parents and children forever shaped by this social experiment.
consensus: As illuminating as it is accessible, One Child Nation probes a painful chapter in Chinese history with piercing clarity.
producer: Christopher Clements, Julie Goldman, Carolyn Hepburn, Christoph Jörg
crew: Nanfu Wang, Jialing Zhang, Christopher Clements, Julie Goldman, Carolyn Hepburn, Christoph Jörg, Lois Vossen, Yuanchen Liu, Nanfu Wang

title: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds
synopsis: A portrait of Hollywood royalty Carrie Fisher and her mother, Debbie Reynolds.
consensus: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds is a touching, bittersweet, and ultimately charming love story that serves as a poignantly effective tribute to the strangely complicated, uniquely resilient mother/daughter duo.
producer: Alexis Bloom, Todd Fisher, Julie Nives
crew: Carrie Fisher, Debbie Reynolds, Alexis Bloom, Fisher Stevens, Alexis Bloom, Todd Fisher, Sheila Nevins, Brett Ratner, Vasco Nunes, Penelope Falk

title: Hoop Dreams
synopsis: Every school day, African-American teenagers William Gates and Arthur Agee travel 90 minutes each way from inner-city Chicago to St. Joseph High School in Westchester, Illinois, a predominately white suburban school well-known for the excellence of its basketball program. Gates and Agee dream of NBA stardom, and with the support of their close-knit families, they battle the social and physical obstacles that stand in their way. This acclaimed documentary was shot over the course of five years.
consensus: One of the most critically acclaimed documentaries of all time, Hoop Dreams is a rich, complex, heartbreaking, and ultimately deeply rewarding film that uses high school hoops as a jumping-off point to explore issues of race, class, and education in modern America.
producer: Peter Gilbert, Steve James, Frederick Marx
crew: Sheila Agee, Isiah Thomas, Bill Gleason, Frederick Marx, Gordon Quinn, Catherine Allan, Peter Gilbert, Frederick Marx, Ben Sidran, Peter Gilbert

title: Waltz With Bashir
synopsis: Israeli filmmaker Ari Folman wrote, directed and stars in this autobiographical animated film. As a 19-year-old infantry soldier in the 1982 war with Lebanon, Folman witnessed the Sabra and Shatila massacre, but realizes that he has no memory of the event. In 2006, he seeks out others who were in Beirut at the time to discuss their memories, including a psychologist specializing in post-traumatic stress disorders and the first journalist to cover the massacre.
consensus: A wholly innovative, original, and vital history lesson, with pioneering animation, Waltz With Bashir delivers its message about the Middle East in a mesmerizing fashion.
rating: R (Dist. Images of Atrocities|Brief Nudity|Graphic Sexual Violence|Strong Violence)
producer: Ari Folman, Serge Lalou, Gerhard Meixner, Roman Paul
crew: Ron Ben-Yishai, Ronny Dayag, Ari Folman, Dror Harazi, Yehezkel Lazarov, Mickey Leon, Ari Folman, Ari Folman, Ari Folman, Serge Lalou, Gerhard Meixner, Roman Paul, David Polonsky

title: Waste Land
synopsis: Located just outside Rio de Janeiro, Jardim Gramacho, Brazil, is the world's largest garbage landfill. Modern artist Vik Muniz works with the so-called catadores, the men and women who pick through the refuse, to create art out of recycled materials. Muniz selects six of the garbage pickers to pose as subjects in a series of photographs mimicking famous paintings. In his desire to assist the catadores and change their lives, Muniz finds himself changed as well.
consensus: Waste Land begins with an eco-friendly premise, but quickly transforms into an uplifting portrait of the power of art and the dignity of the human spirit.
director: Lucy Walker, Karen Harley, João Jardim
crew: Vik Muniz, Lucy Walker, Karen Harley, João Jardim, Fernando Meirelles, Jackie De Botton, Angus Aynsley, Moby, Pedro Kos

title: Citizenfour
synopsis: After Laura Poitras received encrypted emails from someone with information on the government's massive covert-surveillance programs, she and reporter Glenn Greenwald flew to Hong Kong to meet the sender, who turned out to be Edward Snowden.
consensus: Part real-life thriller, part sobering examination of 21st century civil liberties, Citizenfour transcends ideology to offer riveting, must-see cinema.
producer: Laura Poitras, Mathilde Bonnefoy, Dirk Wilutzky
crew: Edward Snowden, Julian Assange, Ewen MacAskill, Jeremy Scahill, Kevin Bankston, Laura Poitras, Laura Poitras, Mathilde Bonnefoy, Dirk Wilutzky, Steven Soderbergh, Jeff Skoll, Diane Weyermann, David Menschel, Tom Quinn, Sheila Nevins

title: On the Record
synopsis: Filmmakers Kirby Dick and Amy Ziering examine the sexual assault allegations against hip-hop mogul Russell Simmons.
consensus: On the Record uses harrowing first-person accounts to powerfully and persuasively confront the entrenched sexism of an industry and its culture.
writer: Kirby Dick, Sara Newens, Amy Ziering
crew: Sil Lai Abrams, Tarana Burke, Kimberlé Crenshaw, Jenny Lumet, Kirby Dick, Amy Ziering, Kirby Dick, Sara Newens, Amy Ziering, Dan Cogan, Abigail Disney, Jamie Rogers, Kirby Dick

title: The Interrupters
synopsis: Members of the activist group CeaseFire work to curb violence in their Chicago neighborhoods by intervening in street fights and showing youths a better way to resolve conflicts.
consensus: Impeccably crafted and edited, The Interrupters is a tough and honest documentary about street violence that truly has the power to inspire change.
crew: Tio Hardiman, Gary Slutkin, Kenneth Oliver, Spencer Leak, Fernando Bocanegra, Alex Kotlowitz, Teddy Leifer, Justine Nagan, Gordon Quinn, Alex Kotlowitz, Aaron Wickenden

title: Slay the Dragon
synopsis: Activists work to rid gerrymandering from America's election process.
consensus: Slay the Dragon takes a suitably outraged -- but ultimately optimistic -- look at modern-day gerrymandering that doubles as a heartfelt call to action.
crew: Chris Durrance, Barak Goodman, Barak Goodman, Jeff Skoll, Diane Weyermann, Seth Bomse

title: Afghan Star
synopsis: Director Havana Marking dives into the booming, but still young and growing, world of pop culture in Afghanistan. Newly liberated after more than 30 years of stifling Taliban rule, the country is taken with a fervor for expression. This documentary follows four contestants, including two women, as they audition, sing and compete in a countrywide "American Idol"-type competition called "Pop Idol." Marking uncovers a wonderfully vibrant community, which is also surprisingly accepting.
consensus: An enlightening and sobering documentary on Afghanistan's very own X-Factor.
crew: Havana Marking

title: Project Nim
synopsis: In the 1970s, professor Herb Terrace and his team raise a baby chimp as a human child, as part of an experiment intended to break the language barrier between animals and people.
consensus: Equal parts hilarious, poignant, and heartbreaking, Project Nim not only tells a compelling story masterfully, but also raises the flag on the darker side of human nature.
rating: PG-13 (Drug Content|Disturbing Images|Some Strong Language|Thematic Elements)
crew: Bern Cohen, Reagan Leonard, Anna May Marsh, Dennis Lauricella, Robert Nesi, James Marsh, Elizabeth Hess, John Battsek, Andrew Ruhemann, Jamie Laurenson, Nick Fraser, Simon Chinn, Hugo Grumbar, Michael Simmonds, Jinx Godfrey

title: Strong Island
synopsis: When filmmaker Yance Ford investigates the 1992 murder of a young black man, it becomes an achingly personal journey since the victim, 24-year-old William Ford Jr., was the filmmaker's brother.
consensus: Strong Island uses one family's heartbreaking tragedy to offer a sobering picture of racial injustice in modern America.
crew: Yance Ford, Harvey Walker, Kevin Myers, Lauren Ford, Ed Boyar, Yance Ford, Danny Glover, Michel Merkt, Lisa Nishimura, Laura Poitras, Susan Rockefeller, Jason Spingarn-Koff, Tony Tabatznik, Yance Ford, Joslyn Barnes

title: Iris
synopsis: Filmmaker Albert Maysles pays tribute to nonagenarian Iris Apfel, the quick-witted, longtime interior designer and outspoken champion of eclectic fashion.
consensus: A small, insightful feature with a deceptively thoughtful thesis, Iris adds a bittersweet postscript to director Albert Maysles' filmography.
producer: Jennifer Ash Rudick, Lara Coxson, Rebekah Maysles
crew: Iris Apfel, Mickey Boardman, Linda Fargo, Tavi Gevinson, Carl Apfel, Albert Maysles, Jennifer Ash Rudick, Rebekah Maysles, Doreen Small, Albert Maysles, Nelson Walker III, Sean Price Williams, Paul Lovelace

title: Capturing the Friedmans
synopsis: While preparing a documentary about children's birthday party entertainers, filmmaker Andrew Jarecki learned that one of his subjects, professional clown David Friedman, was the son and brother of two men who had been convicted of child sexual abuse in a high-profile 1980s criminal trial. Using home videos made by the Friedman family before and during the trial, as well as new interviews, Jarecki explores the conflicting stories of the accused, the alleged victims and the investigators.
consensus: A haunting depiction of a disintegrating family, and a powerful argument on the elusiveness of truth.
crew: David Friedman, Jesse Friedman, Andrew Jarecki, Andrew Jarecki, Marc Smerling, Richard Hankin, Adolfo Doring, Andrea Morricone

title: The Fight
synopsis: At a defining moment in American history, a scrappy team of heroic ACLU lawyers battles for abortion rights, immigrant rights, LGBTQ rights and voting rights.
consensus: The Fight takes an engaging look at some of the people working on the front lines for the ACLU -- and makes a passionate case for the legal battles they wage.
director: Elyse Steinberg, Josh Kriegman, Eli Despres
producer: Eli B. Despres, Peggy Drexler, Josh Kriegman, Maya Seidler, Elyse Steinberg, Kerry Washington
crew: Brigitte Amiri, Lee Gelernt, Joshua Block, Jeffery Robinson, Brock Stone, Elyse Steinberg, Eli Despres, Eli B. Despres, Peggy Drexler, Maya Seidler, Elyse Steinberg, Kerry Washington, Matthew Perniciaro

title: Mr. Death: The Rise and Fall of Fred A. Leuchter, Jr.
synopsis: Documentary filmmaker Errol Morris investigates the case of a man who became an authority on capital punishment, but was discredited when he got involved on the wrong side of a court case. Leutcher, a meek man whose appearance belies his grim expertise, develops what he says is a more effective electric chair. Before long he's in demand from officials who want his opinions on other kinds of execution. But when called to aid the case of an accused Holocaust denier, Leutcher's problems begin.
consensus: Mr. Death outlines its subject's controversial life's work with the deeply fascinating and thought-provoking élan film fans have come to expect from director Errol Morris.
producer: Dorothy Aufiero, David Collins, Errol Morris, Kathy Trustman, Michael Williams
crew: Fred A. Leuchter Jr., Robert Jan Van Pelt, David Irving, James Roth, Shelly Shapiro, Suzanne Tabasky, Ernst Zündel, David Collins, Errol Morris, Dorothy Aufiero, David Collins, Errol Morris, David Schisgall, Jonathan Sehring, John Sloss, Kathy Trustman

title: Rewind
synopsis: Digging through his father's home videos, a young man reconstructs the story of his boyhood and recalls the abuse he suffered through.
consensus: Rewind pulls at the roots of a family's horrific trauma with a deeply personal documentary that's hard to watch, but worth the effort.
producer: Avela Grenier, Shasta Grenier, Robert Schneeweis
crew: Sasha Joseph Neulinger, Sasha Joseph Neulinger, Avela Grenier, Shasta Grenier, Robert Schneeweis, Cindy Meehl, Thomas Winston, Jeff Dougherty, Avela Grenier

title: Nothing Like a Dame
synopsis: Spend a delightfully bawdy afternoon with four legends of British stage and cinema -- Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Eileen Atkins and Joan Plowright -- as they spill the tea on life, love and art.
consensus: Tea with the Dames proves there's plenty of entertainment value to be found in rounding up a quartet of screen legends for a chat -- and is likely to leave audiences wishing these stars would keep brewing up pots for an ongoing series.
crew: Judi Dench, Maggie Smith, Eileen Atkins, Joan Plowright, Roger Michell, Sally Angel, Karen Steyn, Sally Angel, Debbie Manners, Jamie Carmichael, Eben Bolter

title: A Secret Love
synopsis: A former baseball player keeps her lesbian relationship a secret from her family for seven decades.
consensus: In telling one couple's story, A Secret Love pays understated yet powerful tribute to a lifetime of choices and sacrifices made in the name of enduring devotion.
producer: Alexa L. Fogel, Brendan Mason, Ryan Murphy
crew: Pat Henschel, Chris Bolan, Chris Bolan, Alexa L. Fogel, Jason Blum, Alexis Martin Woodall, Alexa L. Fogel, Brendan Mason, Ryan Murphy, Stephen Kazmierski, Bernadine Colish

title: The Invisible War
synopsis: A filmmaker explores the ever-increasing incidents of violent sexual assault within the U.S. military.
consensus: The Invisible War is a vital and frank expose on sexual assault in the U.S. military, shot by master filmmaker Kirby Dick (This Film is Not Yet Rated).
writer: Kirby Dick, Amy Ziering, Douglas Blush
crew: Amy Ziering, Kirby Dick, Kori Cioca, Ariana Klay, Elle Helmer, Hannah Sewell, Kirby Dick, Kirby Dick, Amy Ziering, Douglas Blush, Teddy Leifer, Sarah E. Johnson, Tanner King Barklow, Amy Ziering

title: Sound City
synopsis: Artists and producers highlight the history of the recording studio in Van Nuys, Calif., and discuss the impact of music in the age of technology.
consensus: Smart, affectionate, and unabashedly sincere, Sound City pairs a great soundtrack with a well-argued ode to one of rock 'n' roll's most fondly remembered bygone eras.
producer: David Grohl, John Ramsay, James A. Rota
crew: Frank Black, Kevin Cronin, Rivers Cuomo, Warren DeMartini, Mark Monroe, John Ramsay, James A. Rota, Kenny Stoff, Paul Crowder

title: 56 Up
synopsis: Continuing a project he began in 1964, filmmaker Michael Apted revisits his original subjects and sees how their lives are progressing now that they are 56 years old.
consensus: Director Michael Apted continues to utilize cinema as a window into the lives of everyday people, and in the reflection of this documentary we can glimpse our own aging humanity.
crew: Michael Apted, Bruce Balden, Jacqueline Bassett, Symon Basterfield, Andrew Brackfield, John Brisby, Michael Apted, Paul Almond, Alexander Gardiner, Michael Apted, Claire Lewis, George Jesse Turner, Rik Curtis

title: Elaine Stritch: Shoot Me
synopsis: Plagued by medical issues and memory lapses, the Broadway icon contemplates retirement and mortality as she approaches her 87th birthday and rehearses for a new show.
consensus: Brutally honest and utterly compelling, Elaine Stritch: Shoot Me offers a riveting, vanity-free portrait of its legendary subject while offering a few essential truths about the human condition.
crew: Chiemi Karasawa, Chiemi Karasawa, Elizabeth Hemmerdinger, Alec Baldwin, Cheryl Wiesenfeld, Joshua Z Weinstein, Kjerstin Rossi, Pax Wassermann

title: My Journey Through French Cinema
synopsis: Filmmaker Bertrand Tavernier examines the great directors, actors, writers, composers and cinematographers of French cinema, including Jean Renoir, Jean-Luc Godard, Jean-Pierre Melville, Edmond T. Gréville and Guy Gilles.
consensus: Bertrand Tavernier is an engaging guide through this Journey Through French Cinema, curating a revelatory tour through his homeland's film history with a personal touch that will delight movie fans and the culturally curious alike.
crew: Bertrand Tavernier, Thierry Frémaux, Jacques Becker, Jean-Paul Belmondo, Marcel Carné, Claude Chabrol, Eddie Constantine, Raoul Coutard, Bertrand Tavernier, Bertrand Tavernier, Guy Lecorne, Marie Deroudille, Bruno Coulais

title: Last Train Home
synopsis: Annually, an estimated 130 million factories workers in China migrate from their city of employment back to the village they grew up in. This documentary spotlights married couple Chen and Zhang as they make their own journey. Chen and Zhang must struggle to reconnect with their children, whom they see only once a year. When they discover that their daughter has decided to drop out of school to work at a factory herself, they begin questioning the value of their sacrifice.
consensus: Last Train Home is a haunting, vivid documentary exploring the human toll of China's economic boom in intimate, unforgettable detail.
crew: Lixin Fan, Mila Aung-Thwin, Daniel Cross, Olivier Alary, Lixin Fan, Yung Chang, Lixin Fan, Mary Stephen

title: The Act of Killing
synopsis: Filmmakers expose the horrifying mass executions of accused communists in Indonesia and those who are celebrated in their country for perpetrating the crime.
consensus: Raw, terrifying, and painfully difficult to watch, The Act of Killing offers a haunting testament to the edifying, confrontational power of documentary cinema.
genre: crime, history, documentary, war, drama, biography
crew: Anwar Congo, Jusuf Kalla, Werner Herzog, Errol Morris, Anne Köhncke

title: The Look of Silence
synopsis: An optician confronts the men who killed the brother that he never knew during the 1960s Indonesian genocide.
consensus: The Look of Silence delivers a less shocking -- yet just as terribly compelling -- companion piece to Joshua Oppenheimer's The Act of Killing.
rating: PG-13 (Thematic Material|Graphic Desc. of Inhumanity|Graphic Desc. of Atrocities)
crew: Werner Herzog, Errol Morris, André Singer, Nils Pagh Andersen

title: More Than Honey
synopsis: Beekeepers, scientists and others discuss the world's declining bee population and what it may mean for modern society.
consensus: A rare advocacy documentary that fully trusts its subject's ability to fascinate, More Than Honey enlightens without badgering -- and is all the more effective for it.
crew: John Hurt, Markus Imhoof

title: Everyday Sunshine: The Story of Fishbone
synopsis: With a blistering combination of punk and funk, Fishbone demolishes the walls of genres and challenges the racial stereotypes and political order of the music industry and the nation.
consensus: Everyday Sunshine: The Story of Fishbone is an entertaining, heartwarming, and balanced documentary about the influential Los Angeles band.
crew: Norwood Fisher, Angelo Moore, Chris Dowd, Walter A. Kibby, Kendall Jones, Phillip Fisher, Lev Anderson, Chris Metzler, Lev Anderson, Chris Metzler, Lev Anderson, Chris Metzler, Jeff Springer, Jeff Springer

title: Bill Cunningham New York
synopsis: Bill Cunningham, one of the mainstays of the New York Times, has been a contributor to the renowned newspaper for many decades. He's also an incurable and eccentric chronicler of fashion, tirelessly snapping photos of and writing about interestingly attired celebrities and ordinary New Yorkers he spots on the street. This exhaustive profile of Cunningham and his work includes interviews with friends -- and often subjects -- Tom Wolfe, David Rockefeller and Vogue magazine's Anna Wintour.
consensus: Suffused with happiness and modest charm, Bill Cunningham New York offers a touching, gently humorous portrait of its subject without invading his jealously guarded privacy.
crew: Bill Cunningham, Editta Sherman, Anna Wintour, Iris Apfel, Richard Press, Philip Gefter, Ryan Denmark

title: Spellbound
synopsis: Eight youthful competitors, sponsored by their hometown newspapers, travel with their families to Washington, D.C., to compete in the 1999 Scripps National Spelling Bee. Now in the national spotlight and under heavy pressure to perform from parents, teachers and their audience, the children struggle to advance toward the championship -- and its accompanying scholarships and cash prizes -- while approaching competitive spelling with the focus and intensity of Olympic athletes.
consensus: A suspenseful, gripping documentary that features an engaging cross section of American children.
crew: Paige Kimble, Jonathan Knisely, Balu Natarajan, Julianne Ruth, Jeffrey Blitz, Jeffrey Blitz, Jeffrey Blitz, Sean Welch

title: We Were Here
synopsis: During the 1970s, San Francisco became a safe haven for the gay and lesbian community, providing a place where one could live openly, away from discrimination. But, after almost a decade of celebration, the city was hit by a wave of shock and grief when it became ground zero of the AIDS epidemic, with hundreds of gay men falling victim to the disease. Director David Weissman explores the incredible story of love and loss through the eyes of five men and women who experienced it firsthand.
consensus: We Were Here revisits the crises facing the gay community in the early 1980s -- and offers a powerful tribute to the inspiring resolve shown at a time of turmoil.
genre: history, documentary, gay and lesbian, drama, biography
crew: Paul Boneberg, Ed Wolf, David Weissman, Bill Weber, David Weissman

title: Enron: The Smartest Guys in the Room
synopsis: This documentary explores the fall of the Enron Corporation, arguably the most shocking example of modern corporate corruption. The company is linked with several illegal schemes, including instigating the California energy crisis as a way to drive up utility prices at the expense of the average American. In a hyper-competitive environment, Enron traders resort to all kinds of underhanded dealings in order to make money at any cost and keep their high-paying jobs.
consensus: A concise, entertaining documentary about the spectacular failure of Enron.
producer: Alex Gibney, Jason Kliot, Susan Motamed
crew: Peter Coyote, Alex Gibney, Mark Cuban, Todd Wagner, Joana Vicente, Alex Gibney, Jason Kliot, Susan Motamed, Maryse Alberti, Alison Ellwood, Alison Ellwood

title: Sholem Aleichem: Laughing in the Darkness
synopsis: Filmmaker Joseph Dorman presents the life, work and legacy of the Yiddish writer who used the vernacular of the common man.
consensus: Sholem Aleichem: Laughing in the Darkness serves as an effective primer on its subject, as well as an evocative portrait of the era in which he lived.
crew: Alan Rosenberg, Rachel Dratch, Joseph Dorman, Joseph Dorman

title: 13TH
synopsis: Filmmaker Ava DuVernay explores the history of racial inequality in the United States, focusing on the fact that the nation's prisons are disproportionately filled with African-Americans.
consensus: 13th strikes at the heart of America's tangled racial history, offering observations as incendiary as they are calmly controlled.
producer: Spencer Averick, Howard Barish, Ava DuVernay
crew: Bryan Stevenson, Van Jones, Newt Gingrich, Grover Norquist, Ava DuVernay, Spencer Averick, Ava DuVernay, Spencer Averick, Howard Barish, Ava DuVernay

title: Rivers and Tides: Andy Goldsworthy With Time
synopsis: Andy Goldsworthy's art is supposed to fall apart. He creates large-scale outdoor sculptures and artworks out of natural materials like mud, wood, ice and stone in an attempt to imbue the physical world with a spiritual, ephemeral element. Director Thomas Riedelsheimer follows Goldsworthy as he constructs his art everywhere from upstate New York to his home village in Scotland, and questions the solitary artist about his inspirations, frustrations and artistic goals.
consensus: Andy Goldsworthy and his art are beautifully captured in this engaging documentary.
crew: Andy Goldsworthy, Thomas Riedelsheimer, Annedore von Donop, Fred Frith, Thomas Riedelsheimer, Thomas Riedelsheimer

title: How to Survive a Plague
synopsis: In the late 1980s, members of Act-Up and other AIDS activists battle indifference and hostility to bring attention to the disease and play a huge role in reducing the number of AIDS-related fatalities in the U.S.
consensus: Angry, powerful, and stirring, How to Survive a Plague is a brilliantly constructed documentary about the activists who pushed for action to combat the AIDS epidemic.
genre: gay and lesbian, drama, history, documentary
writer: Tyler H. Walk, David France, T. Woody Richman
crew: David Barr, Jim Eigo, Ann Northrop, Larry Kramer, Gregg Bordowitz, Peter Staley, David France, Tyler H. Walk, David France, T. Woody Richman, Dan Cogan, Joy A. Tomchin, David France, Howard Gertler, Todd Woody Richman, Tyler H. Walk

title: This Is Not a Film
synopsis: Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi makes a video diary with his phone in response to his government's threats against him.
consensus: Through simple means and filming, This is Not a Film presents a vital political statement and a snapshot of life in Iran as enemy of the state.
crew: Jafar Panahi, Mojtaba Mirtahmasb, Jafar Panahi, Mojtaba Mirtahmasb, Jafar Panahi, Jafar Panahi, Jafar Panahi

title: When We Were Kings
synopsis: On October 30, 1974, perhaps the most famous heavyweight championship boxing match of all time took place in Kinshasa, Zaire: the "Rumble in the Jungle" between champion George Foreman and challenger Muhammad Ali. In historical footage and new interviews, this documentary explores the relationship between African-Americans and the African continent during the Black Power era in terms of both popular culture and international politics, including the brutality of then-dictator Mobutu Sese Seko.
consensus: An engrossing documentary that's as much about a time and a place as it is about a fight.
crew: Muhammad Ali, Don King, B.B. King, Spike Lee, Norman Mailer, George Plimpton, Thomas Hauser, Malick Bowens, Leon Gast, David Sonenberg, Taylor Hackford, Leon Gast, Miriam Makeba, Maryse Alberti, Paul Goldsmith, Kevin Keating, Albert Maysles, Leon Gast

title: RBG
synopsis: An intimate portrait of an unlikely rock star: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. With unprecedented access, the filmmakers explore how her early legal battles changed the world for women.
consensus: RBG might be preaching to the choir of viewers who admire Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg, but it does so effectively.
crew: Ruth Bader Ginsburg, Gloria Steinem, Nina Totenberg, Brenda Feigen, Ted Olson, Frank Chi, Stephen Wiesenfeld, Kathleen Peratis, Betsy West, Betsy West, Amy Entelis, Courtney Sexton, Claudia Raschke, Miriam Cutler

title: The Painter and the Thief
synopsis: Czech artist Barbora Kysilkova develops an unlikely friendship with the man who stole two of her paintings.
consensus: The Painter and the Thief uses the unlikely bond between a criminal and his victim as the canvas for a compelling portrait of compassion and forgiveness.
crew: Barbora Kysilkova, Karl-Bertil Nordland, Øystein Stene, Benjamin Ree, Ingvil Giske, Morgan Neville, Uno Helmersson

title: March of the Penguins
synopsis: At the end of each Antarctic summer, the emperor penguins of the South Pole journey to their traditional breeding grounds in a fascinating mating ritual that is captured in this documentary by intrepid filmmaker Luc Jacquet. The journey across frozen tundra proves to be the simplest part of the ritual, as after the egg is hatched, the female must delicately transfer it to the male and make her way back to the distant sea to nourish herself and bring back food to her newborn chick.
consensus: Only the most hardened soul won't be moved by this heartwarming doc.
producer: Yves Darondeau, Christophe Lioud, Emmanuel Priou
crew: Morgan Freeman, Luc Jacquet, Jordan Roberts, Yves Darondeau, Christophe Lioud, Emmanuel Priou, Ilann Girard, Laurent Chalet, Sabine Emiliani

title: Hitchcock/Truffaut
synopsis: Filmmakers Martin Scorsese, David Fincher, Wes Anderson and others discuss the legacy of Alfred Hitchcock and the book "Hitchcock" by François Truffaut.
consensus: Essential viewing for cineastes while still offering rich rewards for neophytes, Hitchcock/Truffaut offers an affectionate -- and well-crafted -- tribute to a legend.
crew: Wes Anderson, Olivier Assayas, Paul Schrader, Arnaud Desplechin, David Fincher, James Gray, Richard Linklater, Kiyoshi Kurosawa, Martin Scorsese, Kent Jones, Kent Jones, Serge Toubiana, Olivier Mille, Charles S. Cohen, Rachel Reichman, Jeremiah Bornfield

title: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck
synopsis: Filmmaker Brett Morgen uses material from the Cobains' personal archives in an in-depth examination of the Nirvana frontman's childhood, music career and untimely death.
consensus: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck makes a persuasive case for its subject without resorting to hagiography -- and includes plenty of rare and unreleased footage for fans.
crew: Courtney Love, Tracey Marander, Krist Novoselic, Brett Morgen, Brett Morgen, Brett Morgen, Sheila Nevins, Frances Bean Cobain, David Byrnes, Eric Edwards

title: Cave of Forgotten Dreams
synopsis: In this documentary, filmmaker Werner Herzog and a small crew are given a rare chance to film inside France's Chauvet Cave, where the walls are covered with the world's oldest surviving paintings. To preserve the art, people are allowed to enter the site for only two weeks a year. Examining the 30,000-year-old drawings, Herzog discusses how the artwork represents humanity's earliest dreams with scientists and art scholars conducting research at Chauvet.
consensus: Hauntingly filmed and brimming with Herzog's infectious enthusiasm, Cave of Forgotten Dreams is a fascinating triumph.
crew: Werner Herzog, Werner Herzog, Werner Herzog, Peter Zeitlinger

title: The King of Kong: A Fistful of Quarters
synopsis: Named "Video Game Player of the Century" in 1999, Billy Mitchell sets a record score in "Donkey Kong" that many felt would never be broken. In 2003 Steve Wiebe, who has recently lost his job, learns about the record, sets out to beat it and does. So both men embark on a cross-country battle for inclusion in the 2007 Guinness Book of World Records as the supreme king of the electronic game.
consensus: The King of Kong is funny and compelling with more than a few poignant insights into human behavior. Director Seth Gordon presents the dueling King Kong players in all their obsessive complexity and with perfectly al dente observations.
crew: Steve Wiebe, Mark Alpiger, Walter Day, Steve Sanders, Robert Mruczek, Todd Rogers, Seth Gordon, Seth Gordon, Ed Cunningham, Seth Gordon, Seth Gordon

title: Bowling for Columbine
synopsis: Political documentary filmmaker Michael Moore explores the circumstances that lead to the 1999 Columbine High School massacre and, more broadly, the proliferation of guns and the high homicide rate in America. In his trademark provocative fashion, Moore accosts Kmart corporate employees and pleads with them to stop selling bullets, investigates why Canada doesn't have the same excessive rate of gun violence and questions actor Charlton Heston on his support of the National Rifle Association.
consensus: Though it may not always convince, Bowling for Columbine asks important questions and provokes thought.
producer: Charles Bishop, Jim Czarnecki, Michael Donovan, Kathleen Glynn, Michael Moore
crew: George W. Bush, Dick Clark, Charlton Heston, Marilyn Manson, John Nichols, Matt Stone, Charles Bishop, Jim Czarnecki, Michael Donovan, Kathleen Glynn, Wolfram Tichy, Kurt Engfehr, Tia Lessin

title: The Fog of War
synopsis: Former corporate whiz kid Robert McNamara was the controversial Secretary of Defense in the Kennedy and Johnson administrations, during the height of the Vietnam War. This Academy Award-winning documentary, augmented by archival footage, gives the conflicted McNamara a platform on which he attempts to confront his and the U.S. government's actions in Southeast Asia in light of the horrors of modern warfare, the end of ideology and the punitive judgment of history.
consensus: The Fog of War draws on decades of bitter experience to offer a piercing perspective on the Cold War from one of its major architects.
producer: Errol Morris, Michael Williams, Julie Ahlberg
crew: Robert S. McNamara, Lyndon B. Johnson, Errol Morris, Errol Morris, Julie Ahlberg, Jack Lechner, Jon Kamen, Frank Scherma, Robert May, John Sloss

title: Muscle Shoals
synopsis: Filmmaker Greg Camalier pays tribute to an Alabama city that holds a prominent place in music history. Artists who recorded at FAME Studios in Muscle Shoals, Ala., include Percy Sledge, Aretha Franklin and Lynyrd Skynyrd.
consensus: Essential for soul fans and entertaining for novices, Muscle Shoals offers a compelling, warts-and-all glimpse at one of the most fascinating stories in modern American music.
crew: Stephen Badger, Aretha Franklin, Alicia Keys, Bono, Jimmy Cliff, Greg "Freddy" Camalier, Matthew Freud, Richard Lowe, Anthony Arendt

title: Circus of Books
synopsis: In 1976 a couple take over an adult book store, and the store becomes the biggest distributor of gay porn in the United States.
consensus: Like the cheekily named store at this documentary's center, Circus of Books proves there are countless stories below the surface if we're only willing to look.
producer: Adam Baran, Cynthia Childs, Camilla Hall, Kathryn Robson
crew: Rachel Mason, Larry Flynt, Jeff Stryker, Phil Tarley, Alaska Thunderfuck, Rachel Mason, Kathryn Robson, Rachel Mason, John Battsek, Adam Baran, Cynthia Childs, Camilla Hall, Kathryn Robson

title: Boys State
synopsis: Texas teens learn about American democracy by organizing political parties and running a mock government.
consensus: Startling, upsetting, and overall absorbing, Boys State strikingly depicts American political divisions -- and machinations -- taking root in the next generation.
crew: Jesse Moss, Jesse Moss, Davis Guggenheim, Jonathan Silberberg, Nicole Stott, Jeff Seymann Gilbert

title: The War Tapes
synopsis: Filmmaker Deborah Scranton provides three U.S. soldiers with cameras so they can document their experiences during Operation Iraqi Freedom. The soldiers, Sgt. Steve Pink, Sgt. Zack Bazzi and Spc. Mike Moriarty, are all different ages and come from different backgrounds, but all three demonstrate unwavering loyalty to their comrades-in-arms while voicing concerns about America's reasons for its presence in Iraq.
consensus: Candid, eye-opening footage gives viewers a close-up -- and educational -- look at the experiences of American soldiers in Iraq, a viewpoint not normally seen.
crew: Deborah Scranton, Robert May, Chuck Lacy, Zack Bazzi, P.H. O'Brien, Stephen Pink, Duncan Domey, Brandon Wilkins

title: Searching for Sugar Man
synopsis: Though he faded into obscurity in the U.S., an early '70s musician known as Rodriguez became a huge hit in South Africa and was widely rumored to have died. Two obsessed fans set out to learn the man's true fate.
consensus: A fascinating portrait of a forgotten musical pioneer, Searching for Sugar Man is by turns informative and mysterious.
producer: George Chignell, Simon Chinn, Nicole Stott
crew: Stephen 'Sugar' Segerman, Dennis Coffey, Mike Theodore, Steve Rowland, Willem Möller, Craig Bartholomew Strydom, Malik Bendjelloul, Malik Bendjelloul, John Battsek, George Chignell, Simon Chinn, Nicole Stott, Malik Bendjelloul

title: Disclosure
synopsis: A look at Hollywood's depiction of transgender people and the impact of this on American culture.
consensus: Disclosure engrossingly illuminates the history and effects of the way transgender lives are depicted onscreen -- and outlines how much progress still needs to be made.
crew: Laverne Cox, Bianca Leigh, Jen Richards, Alexandra Billings, Susan Stryker, Yance Ford, Sam Feder, Laverne Cox, Charlotte Cook, Sam Feder, Amy Scholder, Stacy Goldate

title: Black Panther
synopsis: After the death of his father, T'Challa returns home to the African nation of Wakanda to take his rightful place as king. When a powerful enemy suddenly reappears, T'Challa's mettle as king -- and as Black Panther -- gets tested when he's drawn into a conflict that puts the fate of Wakanda and the entire world at risk. Faced with treachery and danger, the young king must rally his allies and release the full power of Black Panther to defeat his foes and secure the safety of his people.
consensus: Black Panther elevates superhero cinema to thrilling new heights while telling one of the MCU's most absorbing stories -- and introducing some of its most fully realized characters.
rating: PG-13 (Sequences of Action Violence|A Brief Rude Gesture)
crew: Chadwick Boseman, Michael B. Jordan, Lupita Nyong'o, Danai Gurira, Martin Freeman, Daniel Kaluuya, Letitia Wright, Winston Duke, Angela Bassett, Forest Whitaker, Ryan Coogler, Ryan Coogler, Joe Robert Cole, Kevin Feige, Louis D'Esposito, Victoria Alonso, Nate Moore, Jeffrey Chernov, Stan Lee, Rachel Morrison

title: Citizen Kane
synopsis: When a reporter is assigned to decipher newspaper magnate Charles Foster Kane's (Orson Welles) dying words, his investigation gradually reveals the fascinating portrait of a complex man who rose from obscurity to staggering heights. Though Kane's friend and colleague Jedediah Leland (Joseph Cotten), and his mistress, Susan Alexander (Dorothy Comingore), shed fragments of light on Kane's life, the reporter fears he may never penetrate the mystery of the elusive man's final word, "Rosebud."
consensus: Orson Welles's epic tale of a publishing tycoon's rise and fall is entertaining, poignant, and inventive in its storytelling, earning its reputation as a landmark achievement in film.
writer: Herman J. Mankiewicz, Orson Welles, John Houseman
crew: Orson Welles, Joseph Cotten, Ruth Warrick, Everett Sloane, Agnes Moorehead, Dorothy Comingore, Ray Collins, George Coulouris, William Alland, Paul Stewart, Orson Welles, Herman J. Mankiewicz, Orson Welles, John Houseman, Orson Welles, Bernard Herrmann, Gregg Toland, Robert Wise, Van Nest Polglase, Perry Ferguson

title: Parasite
synopsis: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.
consensus: An urgent, brilliantly layered look at timely social themes, Parasite finds writer-director Bong Joon Ho in near-total command of his craft.
crew: Song Kang-ho, Yeo-jeong Jo, Woo-sik Choi, Lee Seon-gyun, Lee Jeong-eun, Jang Hyejin, Bong Joon-ho, Han Jinwon, Gyeong-pyo Hong, Choi Seyeon

title: Avengers: Endgame
synopsis: Adrift in space with no food or water, Tony Stark sends a message to Pepper Potts as his oxygen supply starts to dwindle. Meanwhile, the remaining Avengers -- Thor, Black Widow, Captain America and Bruce Banner -- must figure out a way to bring back their vanquished allies for an epic showdown with Thanos -- the evil demigod who decimated the planet and the universe.
consensus: Exciting, entertaining, and emotionally impactful, Avengers: Endgame does whatever it takes to deliver a satisfying finale to Marvel's epic Infinity Saga.
crew: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Hemsworth, Scarlett Johansson, Jeremy Renner, Brie Larson, Paul Rudd, Don Cheadle, Karen Gillan, Anthony Russo, Joe Russo, Christopher Markus, Stephen McFeely, Kevin Feige, Louis D'Esposito, Victoria Alonso, Michael Grillo, Trinh Tran, Jon Favreau

title: Casablanca
synopsis: Rick Blaine (Humphrey Bogart), who owns a nightclub in Casablanca, discovers his old flame Ilsa (Ingrid Bergman) is in town with her husband, Victor Laszlo (Paul Henreid). Laszlo is a famed rebel, and with Germans on his tail, Ilsa knows Rick can help them get out of the country.
